title: Stadion SK Prosek
text:
Stadion SK Prosek is a <a href="stadium">stadium</a> in <a href="Prague">Prague</a>, <a href="Czech%20Republic">Czech Republic</a>. It is currently used mostly for <a href="association%20football">football</a> matches and is the home ground of <a href="FK%20Bohemians%20Prague%20%28St%C5%99%C3%AD%C5%BEkov%29">FK Bohemians Prague (Střížkov)</a>.
History.
When the club played in the <a href="Czech%20First%20League">Czech First League</a> between 2008 and 2010, the ground was not used for league matches, with the club using <a href="FK%20Viktoria%20Stadion">FK Viktoria Stadion</a> and <a href="Stadion%20Ev%C5%BEena%20Ro%C5%A1ick%C3%A9ho">Stadion Evžena Rošického</a> instead. The club only used the stadium for training. Before the club's promotion to the Czech First League in 2008, the club had played in <a href="Horn%C3%AD%20Po%C4%8Dernice">Horní Počernice</a>. The club moved to the stadium in <a href="St%C5%99%C3%AD%C5%BEkov">Střížkov</a> in time for the 2011–12 season, in which they played in the 2. Liga.
Transport.
The ground is around 15 minutes' walk from the <a href="St%C5%99%C3%AD%C5%BEkov%20%28Prague%20Metro%29">Střížkov metro station</a>.
